RE: License. #: CI630201231
Dear Mr. Sharobeem:
This letter is a follow-up to the Department’s findings regarding the interim inspection
conducted at your child caring institution on July 18, 2002. The purpose of this
inspection was to determine compliance with applicable statutes and administrative
rules.
The violations that were corrected are:
R 400.4128 Initial staff orientation and ongoing staff training.
(1) The licensee shall provide an orientation program for new employees. The
orientation shall include the following:
(a) The institution’s purpose, policies, and procedures, including discipline, crisis
intervention techniques, and emergency and safety procedures.
(b) The role of the staff members as related to service delivery and protection of
the children.
(3) The licensee shall document that each direct care worker participated in a
minimum of 50 clock hours of planned training within the first year of
employment and a minimum of 25 clock hours of training annually thereafter.
The seven records reviewed met the minimum requirements for both initial staff
orientation and on-going staff training.
VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
Address future correspondence to Steve Garcia 248-888-0515.
Your facility was found to be in compliance with the requirements of Act No. 116 of the
Public Acts of 1973, as amended and the applicable Administrative Rules.
Based on the above findings, I recommend the license remains unchanged.
